description: A new dust collection system is needed in order to maintain and improve the health and safety of the working conditions in the aluminum grinding shop. The work under this project consists of the furnishing of all plant, labour, equipment and material to perform the work. The estimated value for this opportunity is in the range of $500,001 to $1,000,000. This is the Phase 2 solicitation following an Invitation to Qualify. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.

full_summary:
## Invitation to Qualify: Dust Collection System Upgrades
### Project Details

Project Title: EB144-240236A D200 Aluminum Grinding - Dust Collection System Upgrades

Project Reference Number: WS4040875851

**Project Overview**

The Department of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) is seeking a qualified supplier to install a new dust collection system at the Aluminum Grinding Shop located in Building D200, CFB Halifax Dockyard, Nova Scotia. The work involves furnishing all necessary plant, labor, equipment, and materials to complete the project.

### Project Requirements

* Installation of a new dust collection system
* Furnishing of all necessary plant, labor, equipment, and materials
* Delivery date: 32 weeks after contract award
* Bid security is a requirement for this tender
* Estimated value: $500,001 to $1,000,000

### Tender Process

This project is being solicited through an Invitation to Qualify (ITQ), with only qualified suppliers invited to bid. The ITQ process follows an Invitation to Qualify that was issued previously.

### Contact Information

For contact information and further details, please refer to the following:

* Contractor Name: Department of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)
* Contractor Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada
* Contact Person: Adam Beaumaster, [adam.beaumaster@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:adam.beaumaster@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Important Details

* This project is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* The project is being executed in accordance with the Procurement Charter.
* Bidders must be in compliance with the Government of Canada's procurement policies and requirements.

### Tender Closing Date

The tender closing date is 2023-07-25T14:00:00.

### Reference Number

WS4040875851

### Number of Amendments

4

### Language of the Tender

English and French. En savoir plus sur la Formation de Documentation exigée
